greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest base b for which A181780(n) is a Fermat pseudoprime.
comment: That is, the smallest b for which b^(s-1) = 1 (mod s), where s is in A181780.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: t = {}; n = 1; While[Length[t] < 100, n++; If[! PrimeQ[n], s = Select[Range[2, n-2], PowerMod[#, n-1, n] == 1 &]; If[s != {}, AppendTo[t, {n, Length[s], s}]]]]; First/@Transpose[t][[3]]
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, Apr 13 2012
